text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus robusta, also called robust oak, is a rare North American species of trees in the beech family. It has been found only in the Chisos Mountains inside Big Bend National Park in western Texas.Quercus robusta is a deciduous tree up to 13 m (43 ft) tall. Bark is black or brown, twigs dark reddish brown. Leaves are up to 12 cm (4 3⁄4 in) long, with a few teeth or small lobes along the edges. The tree grows in moist, wooded canyons.
text.External links: Online Plant Guide includes habit photo of cultivated specimen
